Artificial Intelligence Implementation Plan

This document outlines the Artificial Intelligence Implementation Plan for the United States Marine Corps, spanning Fiscal Years 2025-2030. It’s a strategic plan focused on integrating AI capabilities across various aspects of the Marine Corps’ operations. The plan, currently in Version 1.0, is a living document subject to ongoing refinement and updates based on feedback from various levels within the Department of the Navy (DON) and the Marine Corps. The document’s development has involved multiple iterations, starting with an initial draft (Version 0.1) and progressing through several revisions incorporating feedback from AI Working Groups, AO level personnel, and GS-15 level staff. The revisions demonstrate a collaborative approach, with input from diverse stakeholders including Captain Christopher D. Clark, Dr. Colin Crosby, and Lieutenant General Melvin G. Carter. The plan’s structure includes an Executive Summary and a detailed Approach section. The document’s classification is ‘UNCLASSIFIED,’ indicating it’s publicly releasable after a review process. The version history highlights the iterative nature of the plan’s development, showcasing the incorporation of feedback at different levels of the organization – from Captain to Lieutenant General – and the involvement of the Department of the Navy. The plan’s longevity, extending to 2030, suggests a long-term commitment to AI integration within the Marine Corps. The document’s creation and ongoing revisions underscore the importance of adapting to technological advancements and incorporating operational insights. The inclusion of multiple review stages and feedback loops indicates a robust process for ensuring the plan’s relevance and effectiveness. The document’s classification and the detailed version history are crucial for tracking changes and understanding the evolution of the AI implementation strategy. The plan's focus on a defined timeframe (FY2025-2030) provides a clear roadmap for the Marine Corps’ AI initiatives.
